p: Although the first choice for influenza control and reducing the effects of epidemics is a vaccine, it is also known that it is not the fastest and most effective option since modifications in viral proteins require annual adaptation of the influenza vaccine formulation, as noted by Nachbagauer and Palese (2020). Considering the side effects and complications of antiviral medicines, the search for more effective remedies for fast-spreading pandemic influenza strains continues intensively all over the world today.
